channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Be a Part of RPI’s Premier Cybersecurity Team!
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 2, 2024 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - The #1 collegiate cybersecurity CTF team in the country is looking for new players, so if you’d like to be part of the Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory, just stop by Sage 3101 every Wednesday evening through the end of the semester! No experience necessary, just a willingness to learn and try new things. Contact Dr. Brian Callahan if you have questions.
item.author: Students

item.title: COMM+D to Hold Graduate School Application Essay Workshop
item.description: If you’re applying to graduate schools but aren’t quite sure how to write a personal statement or a statement of purpose, you’re in luck! From 4:00PM to 5:00PM on Wednesday, October 9 in Sage 4510, the Center for Global Communication+Design (COMM+D) will be offering a workshop on writing successful application essays.
item.author: Students

item.title: GEM Fellowship Seeking Candidates for Fully-Funded Graduate Education, Industry Internships
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 9, 2024 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - GEM brings together top universities, industry, and national lab partners to support Masters and PhD students for up to five years. Register to receive the link to attend this info session to learn about the benefits, explore participating partners, and prepare to apply for the November deadline. Please note that candidates must be U.S. citizens or permanent residents.
item.author: Students

item.title: ITWS Co-Terminal Program Info Session Scheduled for October 1
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 1, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Attend this session to learn about the Information Technology & Web Science co-terminal program as Dr. Brian Callahan discusses program requirements, the application process, and upcoming deadlines, and also answers questions. This info session is geared toward first- and second-semester seniors, but all students are welcome to attend.
item.author: Students

item.title: Davies Medal for Engineering Achievement Ceremony to be Held October 7
item.description: Date: Monday, October 7, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:30 PM - RSVP to join Rensselaer and the School of Engineering as they present the Davies Medal for Engineering Achievement to distinguished School of Engineering alum Nicholas T. Pinchuk ’68, ’69G, Chairman and CEO of Snap-on Incorporated. The award ceremony will include a presidential conversation between RPI President Schmidt and Mr. Pinchuk, and will be followed by a reception.
item.author: Community

item.title: Second EMPAC Performance of Dana Michel’s “MIKE” to be Held October 5
item.description: Date: Saturday, October 5, 2024 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Join EMPAC for “MIKE,” Dana Michel’s experimental, durational choreographic work! Accompanied by an inventory of office items, Michel embarks on a series of tasks subject to interruption and absurd redirection. Follow her performance as she travels through the center’s studio venues and public spaces! For accessibility concerns, please contact us for how we can best accommodate you for this event.
item.author: Community

item.title: AI/ML Research Reading Group Meetings to Begin October 2
item.description: If you’re interested in decoding complex AI/ML research, this group’s goal is to read and discuss diverse research papers in the interdisciplinary areas of AI/ML/NLP, IS, and HCI. Whether you’re a novice or a seasoned researcher, all RPI members are welcome to attend the group’s first meeting from 11AM to noon on October 2 in Pittsburgh 4114 to contribute to the discussions; the group will then meet bi-weekly. Contact Lydia Manikonda if you have questions!
item.author: Community

item.title: Chemistry Seminar Series Continues October 1
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 1, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Professor Anyin Li of the University of New Hampshire will present “femto Electrospray Ionization: Extreme Conditions for Optimum Performance.” Refreshments will be served at 3:45 pm.
item.author: Community

item.title: Therapy Dog Group Sessions to Continue October 2
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 2, 2024 5:00 PM - 6:30 PM - Join students in the Mueller Center classroom to relax, de-stress, and pet some furry friends! If you have questions or need more information, please contact Emma Atkinson in the Mueller Center.
item.author: Community

item.title: Physics, Applied Physics and Astronomy Colloquium Series Continues October 2
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 2, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - This colloquium will feature a presentation titled “The National Spherical Torus Experiment Upgrade – Advancing the Physics of Fusion Energy,” by Dr. Andreas Kleiner of the Princeton Plasma Physics Laboratory.
item.author: Community

item.title: Five Short Films to Comprise “a gift horse’s mouth” at EMPAC
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 2, 2024 7:00 PM - Join EMPAC for “a gift horse’s mouth,” featuring short films by various artists that address relationships between the body, mechanical labor, and market forces. These critical artistic accounts ask how the financialization of technical resources impacts agency over our bodies and time.
item.author: Community

item.title: Finance Conference 2024 Scheduled for October 8
item.description:
Date: Tuesday, October 8, 2024 1:00 PM - 4:30 PM - Register to attend RPI’s first annual Finance Conference, a free event that offers a wonderful opportunity for networking and professional development! Topics will include financial reporting, proposal budget preparation, how to generate costs savings, and a demonstration of the new budget and forecasting tool.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
